detaileddescription.para: A break interrupt was received. This happens when the serial input is held at a logic '0' state for longer than the sum of start time + data bits + parity + stop bits.

This error is raised when transmitted data does not match received data. Typically this is useful in scenarios where the TX and RX lines maybe connected together such as RS-485 half-duplex. This error is only valid on UARTs that support collision checking.
Values that correspond to events or errors responsible for stopping receiving.
With flow control set to none, any operations related to flow control signals can be managed by user with uart_line_ctrl functions. In other cases, flow control is managed by hardware/driver.

briefdescription.para: Transmitting aborted due to timeout or uart_tx_abort call.

detaileddescription.para: When flow control is enabled, there is a possibility that TX transfer won't finish in the allotted time. Some data may have been transferred, information about it can be found in event data.

briefdescription.para: Received data is ready for processing.

detaileddescription.para:
This event is generated in the following cases:
When RX timeout occurred, and data was stored in provided buffer. This can happen multiple times in the same buffer.
When provided buffer is full.
After uart_rx_disable().
After stopping due to external event (uart_event_type::UART_RX_STOPPED).

briefdescription.para: Driver requests next buffer for continuous reception.

detaileddescription.para: This event is triggered when receiving has started for a new buffer, i.e. it's time to provide a next buffer for a seamless switchover to it. For continuous reliable receiving, user should provide another RX buffer in response to this event, using uart_rx_buf_rsp function
If uart_rx_buf_rsp is not called before current buffer is filled up, receiving will stop.

briefdescription.para: Buffer is no longer used by UART driver.
RX has been disabled and can be reenabled.

detaileddescription.para: This event is generated whenever receiver has been stopped, disabled or finished its operation and can be enabled again using uart_rx_enable

briefdescription.para: RX has stopped due to external event.

detaileddescription.para: Reason is one of uart_rx_stop_reason.

briefdescription.para: Types of events passed to callback in UART_ASYNC_API.

detaileddescription.para:
Receiving:
To start receiving, uart_rx_enable has to be called with first buffer
When receiving starts to current buffer, uart_event_type::UART_RX_BUF_REQUEST will be generated, in response to that user can either:
Provide second buffer using uart_rx_buf_rsp, when first buffer is filled, receiving will automatically start to second buffer.
Ignore the event, this way when current buffer is filled uart_event_type::UART_RX_RDY event will be generated and receiving will be stopped.
If some data was received and timeout occurred uart_event_type::UART_RX_RDY event will be generated. It can happen multiples times for the same buffer. RX timeout is counted from last byte received i.e. if no data was received, there won't be any timeout event.
After buffer is filled uart_event_type::UART_RX_RDY will be generated, immediately followed by uart_event_type::UART_RX_BUF_RELEASED indicating that current buffer is no longer used.
If there was second buffer provided, it will become current buffer and we start again at point 2. If no second buffer was specified receiving is stopped and uart_event_type::UART_RX_DISABLED event is generated. After that whole process can be repeated.

Any time during reception uart_event_type::UART_RX_STOPPED event can occur. if there is any data received, uart_event_type::UART_RX_RDY event will be generated. It will be followed by uart_event_type::UART_RX_BUF_RELEASED event for every buffer currently passed to driver and finally by uart_event_type::UART_RX_DISABLED event.

Receiving can be disabled using uart_rx_disable, after calling that function, if there is any data received, uart_event_type::UART_RX_RDY event will be generated. uart_event_type::UART_RX_BUF_RELEASED event will be generated for every buffer currently passed to driver and finally uart_event_type::UART_RX_DISABLED event will occur.

Transmitting:
Transmitting starts by uart_tx function.
If whole buffer was transmitted uart_event_type::UART_TX_DONE is generated. If timeout occurred uart_event_type::UART_TX_ABORTED will be generated.
Transmitting can be aborted using uart_tx_abort, after calling that function uart_event_type::UART_TX_ABORTED event will be generated.

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* uart_irq_callback_user_data_t) (const struct device *dev, void *user_data)
memberdef.name: uart_irq_callback_user_data_t

briefdescription.para: Define the application callback function signature for uart_irq_callback_user_data_set() function.
For configuring IRQ on each individual UART device.
Define the application callback function signature for uart_callback_set() function.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to data specified by user.

briefdescription.para: Check whether an error was detected.

parameterdescription.para: Error flags as defined in uart_rx_stop_reason
If no character was available to read (i.e. the UART input buffer was empty).
If the operation is not implemented.
If async reception was enabled using uart_rx_enable

briefdescription.para: Poll the device for wide data input.

parameterdescription.para: If no data was available to read (i.e., the UART input buffer was empty).
If the function is not implemented.
If async reception was enabled using uart_rx_enable

briefdescription.para: Output a character in polled mode.

detaileddescription.para: This routine checks if the transmitter is empty. When the transmitter is empty, it writes a character to the data register.
To send a character when hardware flow control is enabled, the handshake signal CTS must be asserted.

briefdescription.para: Output wide data in polled mode.

detaileddescription.para: This routine checks if the transmitter is empty. When the transmitter is empty, it writes a datum to the data register.
To send a datum when hardware flow control is enabled, the handshake signal CTS must be asserted.
Sets UART configuration using data from *cfg.

parameterdescription.para: Negative errno code in case of failure.
If configuration is not supported by device or driver does not support setting configuration in runtime.

detaileddescription.para: Stores current UART configuration to *cfg, can be used to retrieve initial configuration after device was initialized using data from DTS.

parameterdescription.para: Negative errno code in case of failure.
If driver does not support getting current configuration.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, const uint8_t *tx_data, int size)
memberdef.name: uart_fifo_fill

detaileddescription.para: This function is expected to be called from UART interrupt handler (ISR), if uart_irq_tx_ready() returns true. Result of calling this function not from an ISR is undefined (hardware-dependent). Likewise, not calling this function from an ISR if uart_irq_tx_ready() returns true may lead to undefined behavior, e.g. infinite interrupt loops. It's mandatory to test return value of this function, as different hardware has different FIFO depth (oftentimes just 1).

parameterdescription.para: if this function is not supported

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, const uint16_t *tx_data, int size)
memberdef.name: uart_fifo_fill_u16

detaileddescription.para: This function is expected to be called from UART interrupt handler (ISR), if uart_irq_tx_ready() returns true. Result of calling this function not from an ISR is undefined (hardware-dependent). Likewise, not calling this function from an ISR if uart_irq_tx_ready() returns true may lead to undefined behavior, e.g. infinite interrupt loops. It's mandatory to test return value of this function, as different hardware has different FIFO depth (oftentimes just 1).

parameterdescription.para: If this function is not implemented

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint8_t *rx_data, const int size)
memberdef.name: uart_fifo_read

detaileddescription.para: This function is expected to be called from UART interrupt handler (ISR), if uart_irq_rx_ready() returns true. Result of calling this function not from an ISR is undefined (hardware-dependent). It's unspecified whether "RX ready" condition as returned by uart_irq_rx_ready() is level- or edge- triggered. That means that once uart_irq_rx_ready() is detected, uart_fifo_read() must be called until it reads all available data in the FIFO (i.e. until it returns less data than was requested).
Note that the calling context only applies to physical UARTs and no to the virtual ones found in USB CDC ACM code.

parameterdescription.para: If this function is not implemented.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint16_t *rx_data, const int size)
memberdef.name: uart_fifo_read_u16

detaileddescription.para: This function is expected to be called from UART interrupt handler (ISR), if uart_irq_rx_ready() returns true. Result of calling this function not from an ISR is undefined (hardware-dependent). It's unspecified whether "RX ready" condition as returned by uart_irq_rx_ready() is level- or edge- triggered. That means that once uart_irq_rx_ready() is detected, uart_fifo_read() must be called until it reads all available data in the FIFO (i.e. until it returns less data than was requested).
Note that the calling context only applies to physical UARTs and no to the virtual ones found in USB CDC ACM code.

parameterdescription.para: If this function is not implemented.

briefdescription.para: Check if UART TX buffer can accept a new char.

detaileddescription.para: Check if UART TX buffer can accept at least one character for transmission (i.e. uart_fifo_fill() will succeed and return non-zero). This function must be called in a UART interrupt handler, or its result is undefined. Before calling this function in the interrupt handler, uart_irq_update() must be called once per the handler invocation.

parameterdescription.para: If TX interrupt is enabled and at least one char can be written to UART.
If device is not ready to write a new byte.
If this function is not implemented.

briefdescription.para: Check if UART TX block finished transmission.

detaileddescription.para: Check if any outgoing data buffered in UART TX block was fully transmitted and TX block is idle. When this condition is true, UART device (or whole system) can be power off. Note that this function is not useful to check if UART TX can accept more data, use uart_irq_tx_ready() for that. This function must be called in a UART interrupt handler, or its result is undefined. Before calling this function in the interrupt handler, uart_irq_update() must be called once per the handler invocation.

parameterdescription.para: If nothing remains to be transmitted.
If this function is not implemented.

briefdescription.para: Check if UART RX buffer has a received char.

detaileddescription.para: Check if UART RX buffer has at least one pending character (i.e. uart_fifo_read() will succeed and return non-zero). This function must be called in a UART interrupt handler, or its result is undefined. Before calling this function in the interrupt handler, uart_irq_update() must be called once per the handler invocation. It's unspecified whether condition as returned by this function is level- or edge- triggered (i.e. if this function returns true when RX FIFO is non-empty, or when a new char was received since last call to it). See description of uart_fifo_read() for implication of this.

parameterdescription.para: If a received char is ready.
If a received char is not ready.
If this function is not implemented.

briefdescription.para: Check if any IRQs is pending.

parameterdescription.para: If an IRQ is not pending.
If this function is not implemented.

detaileddescription.para: This function should be called the first thing in the ISR. Calling uart_irq_rx_ready(), uart_irq_tx_ready(), uart_irq_tx_complete() allowed only after this.
The purpose of this function is:

listitem.para: For devices with auto-acknowledge of interrupt status on register read to cache the value of this register (rx_ready, etc. then use this case).
For devices with explicit acknowledgment of interrupts, to ack any pending interrupts and likewise to cache the original value.

For devices with implicit acknowledgment, this function will be empty. But the ISR must perform the actions needs to ack the interrupts (usually, call uart_fifo_read() on rx_ready, and uart_fifo_fill() on tx_ready).

parameterdescription.para: If this function is not implemented.

briefdescription.para: Set the IRQ callback function pointer.

detaileddescription.para: This sets up the callback for IRQ. When an IRQ is triggered, the specified function will be called with specified user data. See description of uart_irq_update() for the requirements on ISR.

parameterdescription.para: Data to pass to callback function.

briefdescription.para: Set the IRQ callback function pointer (legacy).

detaileddescription.para: This sets up the callback for IRQ. When an IRQ is triggered, the specified function will be called with the device pointer.
Since it is mandatory to set callback to use other asynchronous functions, it can be used to detect if the device supports asynchronous API. Remaining API does not have that detection.

parameterdescription.para: Data to pass to event handler function.
If not supported by the device.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, const uint8_t *buf, size_t len, int32_t timeout)
memberdef.name: uart_tx

briefdescription.para: Send given number of bytes from buffer through UART.

detaileddescription.para: Function returns immediately and event handler, set using uart_callback_set, is called after transfer is finished.

parameterdescription.para: Timeout in microseconds. Valid only if flow control is enabled. SYS_FOREVER_US disables timeout.
If There is already an ongoing transfer.
Other negative errno value in case of failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, const uint16_t *buf, size_t len, int32_t timeout)
memberdef.name: uart_tx_u16

briefdescription.para: Send given number of datum from buffer through UART.

detaileddescription.para: Function returns immediately and event handler, set using uart_callback_set, is called after transfer is finished.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to wide data transmit buffer.
Length of wide data transmit buffer.
Timeout in milliseconds. Valid only if flow control is enabled. SYS_FOREVER_MS disables timeout.
If there is already an ongoing transfer.
Other negative errno value in case of failure.

detaileddescription.para: uart_event_type::UART_TX_DONE event will be generated with amount of data sent.

parameterdescription.para: Other negative errno value in case of failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint8_t *buf, size_t len, int32_t timeout)
memberdef.name: uart_rx_enable

detaileddescription.para: Function sets given buffer as first buffer for receiving and returns immediately. After that event handler, set using uart_callback_set, is called with uart_event_type::UART_RX_RDY or uart_event_type::UART_RX_BUF_REQUEST events.

parameterdescription.para: Inactivity period after receiving at least a byte which triggers uart_event_type::UART_RX_RDY event. Given in microseconds. SYS_FOREVER_US disables timeout. See uart_event_type for details.
Other negative errno value in case of failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint16_t *buf, size_t len, int32_t timeout)
memberdef.name: uart_rx_enable_u16

briefdescription.para: Start receiving wide data through UART.

detaileddescription.para: Function sets given buffer as first buffer for receiving and returns immediately. After that event handler, set using uart_callback_set, is called with uart_event_type::UART_RX_RDY or uart_event_type::UART_RX_BUF_REQUEST events.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to wide data receive buffer.
Inactivity period after receiving at least a byte which triggers uart_event_type::UART_RX_RDY event. Given in milliseconds. SYS_FOREVER_MS disables timeout. See uart_event_type for details.
Other negative errno value in case of failure.

briefdescription.para: Provide receive buffer in response to uart_event_type::UART_RX_BUF_REQUEST event.

detaileddescription.para: Provide pointer to RX buffer, which will be used when current buffer is filled.

simplesect.para: Providing buffer that is already in usage by driver leads to undefined behavior. Buffer can be reused when it has been released by driver.

parameterdescription.para: Receiver is already disabled (function called too late?).
Other negative errno value in case of failure.

briefdescription.para: Provide wide data receive buffer in response to uart_event_type::UART_RX_BUF_REQUEST event.

detaileddescription.para: Provide pointer to RX buffer, which will be used when current buffer is filled.

simplesect.para: Providing buffer that is already in usage by driver leads to undefined behavior. Buffer can be reused when it has been released by driver.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to wide data receive buffer.
Receiver is already disabled (function called too late?).
Other negative errno value in case of failure.

detaileddescription.para: uart_event_type::UART_RX_BUF_RELEASED event will be generated for every buffer scheduled, after that uart_event_type::UART_RX_DISABLED event will be generated. Additionally, if there is any pending received data, the uart_event_type::UART_RX_RDY event for that data will be generated before the uart_event_type::UART_RX_BUF_RELEASED events.

parameterdescription.para: Other negative errno value in case of failure.

memberdef.argsstring: (const struct device *dev, uint32_t ctrl, uint32_t val)
